title: SubscriptionOrchestrator — event normalization, dedup, debounce, incremental updates
description:
attached_molecule: po-wisp-zin
attached_at: 2026-02-18T07:37:18Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. SubscriptionOrchestrator per en-p0ha architecture directive (step 7). Coordinates subscriptions across evm-integration and sol-integration. Responsibilities: (1) Lifecycle management — create subscriptions when tracked addresses arrive from wallet-integration, (2) Event normalization — chain-specific events to unified PortfolioUpdateEvent, (3) Deduplication within 500ms window per address per chain, (4) Debouncing — Solana 2s, Polygon 5s, Ethereum/L2s no debounce, (5) Incremental aggregation — fetch only affected asset, merge with cache, emit PortfolioUpdateEvent. Add subscribeToLiveUpdates() and getLiveConnectionStatus() to PortfolioAggregationContract. Mock integration WS interfaces in tests. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode.
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement SubscriptionOrchestrator per en-p0ha architecture directive (step 7).

SubscriptionOrchestrator coordinates subscriptions across evm-integration and sol-integration SubscriptionServices:

1. Lifecycle management: When portfolio-aggregation receives tracked addresses from wallet-integration, create subscriptions via integration SubscriptionServices.

2. Event normalization: Chain-specific subscription events arrive in different formats. Normalize to unified PortfolioUpdateEvent domain events.

3. Deduplication: Multiple events can fire for the same logical update (e.g., Transfer log + balance change on newHeads). Deduplicate within 500ms window per address per chain.

4. Debouncing per-chain: Solana 2s windows, Polygon 5s windows, Ethereum/L2s no debounce needed (12s+ block times).

5. Incremental aggregation: On normalized event, fetch updated data for affected asset only (not full portfolio refresh), merge with cached data, emit incremental PortfolioUpdateEvent.

Add to PortfolioAggregationContract: subscribeToLiveUpdates(): LiveSubscriptionHandle, getLiveConnectionStatus(): Map<ChainId, SubscriptionStatus>.

DEPENDENCY: This requires WebSocket SubscriptionService to exist in evm-integration and sol-integration. Those are being implemented in parallel (ev-* and so-* beads). If the interfaces aren't published yet, implement against the expected interface and mock in tests.

Follow TDD. Reference: enterprise-arch mayor/en-p0ha-websocket-first-architecture.md

title: DeFi position aggregation into portfolio totals
description:
attached_molecule: po-wisp-5jd
attached_at: 2026-02-17T23:05:15Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Wave 4 DeFi aggregation. Read the architecture docs at enterprise-arch (en-9qon + en-v99r dual-path update). Implement: (1) Call getDeFiPositions() on all chain integrations in parallel (same scatter-gather as getBalances). (2) Deduplicate cross-chain positions using deduplicationKey. (3) Aggregate DeFi value into portfolio totals — supply positions add, borrow positions subtract. (4) Request pricing for underlying assets via asset-valuator. (5) Partial failure strategy — one chain failing doesn't block others. (6) Coordinate with getTokens() to prevent double-counting receipt tokens. (7) Expose DeFi positions as first-class portfolio content. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode. Do NOT run E2E tests locally — only build + unit tests.
dispatched_by: mayor

Include DeFi positions in portfolio aggregation and total value calculations. Depends on DeFi protocol integration (ev-E2).

title: E2E: add orchestration E2E tests with mocked integrations
description:
attached_molecule: po-wisp-smo
attached_at: 2026-02-15T05:44:34Z
dispatched_by: mayor

Enterprise E2E strategy (enterprise-arch/e2e-testing-strategy.md) identifies PortfolioAggregation as the highest-priority E2E gap — it validates cross-boundary orchestration.

Action items:
1. Create vitest.e2e.config.ts with jsdom env (React components), 20s timeout
2. Create mock implementations of each integration contract interface (EVM, Solana, Robinhood, AssetValuator)
3. Use DataModels test fixtures for mock data
4. Implement scenarios: full portfolio sync with mocked integrations (P0), asset reconciliation/dedup across sources (P0), single integration failure isolation (P1), all integrations fail gracefully (P1), price enrichment via AssetValuator (P1), portfolio refresh lifecycle (P2), circuit breaker activation (P2)
5. Organize tests under src/tests/e2e/ following DDD test organization
6. No network calls — all integration boundaries mocked
7. Standardize npm script: test:e2e
8. Document E2E strategy in repo ARCHITECTURE.md
9. All tests must pass: npm run build && npm test && npm run test:e2e

### Steps

1. **[open]** Check own context limit

If context is HIGH (>80%):
- Ensure any notes are written to handoff mail
- Prepare for session restart

If context is LOW:
- Can continue patrolling

2. **[open]** Process witness mail

```bash
gt mail inbox
```

For each message:

**POLECAT_STARTED**:
A new polecat has started working. Acknowledge and archive.
```bash

3. **[open]** Process pending cleanup wisps

In the ephemeral model, cleanup wisps are only created when a polecat has
dirty state (uncommitted changes, unpushed commits) that preve...

4. **[open]** Loop or exit for respawn
   End of patrol cycle decision.

**If context LOW** (can continue patrolling):
1. Generate a brief summary of this patrol cycle
2. Squash the current wisp:
```bash
bd mol squash <mol-id> --summary "<pat...

5. **[open]** Ping Deacon for health check
   Send WITNESS_PING to Deacon for second-order monitoring.

The Witness fleet collectively monitors Deacon health - this prevents the
"who watches the watchers" problem. If Deacon dies, Witnesses detect...

6. **[open]** Check if active swarm is complete
   If Mayor started a batch (SWARM_START), check if all polecats have completed.

**Step 1: Find active swarm tracking wisps**

bd list --wisp --labels=swarm --status=open
```
If no active swarm, ...

7. **[open]** Ensure refinery is alive
   Ensure the refinery is alive and processing merge requests.

```bash
# Check if refinery session exists
gt session status <rig>/refinery

# Check for pending merge requests
bd list --type=merge-reques...

8. **[open]** Inspect all active polecats
   Survey all polecats using agent beads (ZFC: trust what agents report).

**Step 1: List polecat agent beads**

```bash
bd list --type=agent --json
```

Filter the JSON output for entries where descript...

9. **[open]** End-of-cycle inbox hygiene
   Verify inbox hygiene before ending patrol cycle.

**Step 1: Check inbox state**
```bash
gt mail inbox
```

In the ephemeral model, most POLECAT_DONE messages are handled immediately
(auto-nuke) and ar...

10. **[open]** Check timer gates for expiration
   Check for expired timer gates and escalate as needed.

Timer gates are async wait conditions with a timeout. When the timeout expires,
the gate should be escalated to the overseer for human interventi...

title: Environment validation and cache isolation in PortfolioAggregation
description:
attached_molecule: po-wisp-0cq
attached_at: 2026-02-14T14:39:00Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly.
dispatched_by: mayor

Add testnet support to PortfolioAggregation. 1) Add environment parameter to SyncOrchestratorService constructor. 2) Create src/infrastructure/validation/EnvironmentValidator.ts — blocks production access when CI=true without explicit opt-in. 3) LocalStoragePortfolioRepository prefixes storage keys with environment (cygnus_portfolios_testnet, etc). 4) Environment propagated to all integration repositories during sync. NOTE: This rig currently cannot npm install due to missing @cygnus-wealth/asset-valuator on npm — cross-package linking must be resolved first.
